DOC.HEADLINE: WAS FAKE LAWYER INEFFECTIVE COUNSEL? APPEAL WILL DECIDE

TEXT.P: DENVER - Gwen Bergman appealed her murder-for-hire case to the 10th Circuit Court in Denver on Thursday in hopes that a three-judge panel will overturn the conviction on grounds she had ineffective counsel.
Bergman was represented by Howard Kieffer, an ex-con who impersonated an attorney during her May 2008 trial in U.S. District Court in Denver last year.
The former Aspen resident was sentenced to nine years in prison.
Federal prosecutors argue the conviction should stand because Kieffer was assisted by licensed co-counsel during the trial and no legal errors occurred.

Bergman's appellate attorney argued the case should have never moved forward to trial because Kieffer alone represented Bergman at a mental competency hearing and he should never have agreed that Bergman was ready to proceed.
Kieffer was convicted of fraud in U.S. District Court in Bismarck, N.D. and sentenced to 51 months in prison.
He is also indicted on fraud charges related to the Bergman case in Colorado and is scheduled for a court appearance in Denver on Dec. 1.
The 10th Circuit judges are expected to issue a decision in several weeks.
